Today the EBA releases the results of the 2014 EU-wide stress tests which aim to assess risks and vulnerabilities in the EU banking sector.
How to read some of the key results from the 2014 EU-wide stress test released tomorrow: http://t.co/mgovRPIZpc
The EBA provides transparency: by publishing comparable data from banks across the EU we help drive market discipline & investor confidence.
The EBA's consistent methodologies and benchmarks give National Supervisors the framework they need to carry out the EU-wide stress tests.
Find out more about the history of EU-wide stress tests ahead of the release of the 2014 results with this timeline http://t.co/9vhfiys05J
EU-wide stress tests assess the resilience of banks under adverse economic developments. Results coming on Sunday.
How to read some of the key results from the 2014 EU-wide stress test released on Sunday: https://t.co/5scdkawCYb
Watch this video in which Piers Haben explains what the EU-wide stress test is & how to read the upcoming results http://t.co/ZkPy2ANCZe
The stress test is a large-scale exercise carried out across 28 EU member   states, on 123 banks - at least 80% of total assets in the EU.

The results of the EU-wide stress tests will be released this Sunday.
Follow @EBA_News for updates & read more here: http://t.co/lkMJnmGE1z
The EBA initiates and coordinates the EU-wide stress tests, working with @ECB and National Supervisors: http://t.co/BppLpxGUZO
The European Banking Authority is now on Twitter. Follow @EBA_News for updates on our work to maintain financial stability in the EU.
